entities.name: Sales
entities.description: Sales represent the total revenue generated from selling products or services.

entities.name: Attitude
entities.description: An attitude is a learned predisposition to respond in a consistently favorable or unfavorable manner with respect to a given object.

entities.name: Increased Sales and Brand Loyalty
entities.description: Increased sales and brand loyalty are positive outcomes for businesses when consumers are engaged and motivated.

entities.name: INDIVIDUALIST CULTURES
entities.description: Cultures that focus more on personal preferences and self-expression in decision-making processes

entities.name: luxury brand
entities.description: A luxury brand is perceived as high-quality and prestigious, often commanding premium prices due to its reputation and branding.

entities.name: PAST EXPERIENCES
entities.description: Previous interactions with a product or brand that shape consumer attitudes and perceptions

entities.name: purchasing decision stages
entities.description: The series of steps involved in making a purchasing choice.

entities.name: customer satisfaction
entities.description: Customer satisfaction is the measure of how well a product or service meets or exceeds customer expectations.

entities.name: PACKAGING
entities.description: The design and presentation of a product, which can influence consumer perceptions and purchasing decisions

entities.name: Cultural differences
entities.description: Influences consumer behavior and preferences across different societies.

entities.name: advertisements
entities.description: Advertisements are used by businesses to influence consumer attitudes and behaviors through various media channels.

attributes.Purpose: To influence consumer attitudes and behaviors
attributes.Media Channels: Various, including TV, radio, print, online, etc.

entities.name: cognitive factors
entities.description: Cognitive factors refer to mental processes and abilities that influence behavior, including perception, memory, reasoning, and problem-solving.

entities.name: attitudes
entities.description: A combination of beliefs, feelings, and behaviors towards a product or brand.

entities.name: social influences
entities.description: External impacts on individual behavior and decision-making.

entities.name: Cultural factors
entities.description: Non-economic forces that shape consumer decisions based on societal norms, values, and traditions.

entities.name: situational factors
entities.description: External conditions or events that influence decision-making.

entities.name: consumer attitudes
entities.description: Consumer attitudes refer to the psychological evaluation and perception of products, services, or brands by individuals.

entities.name: Consumer Perception
entities.description: Consumer perception is the way consumers interpret and understand a product or brand, which can significantly impact their purchasing decisions.

entities.name: NEGATIVE ATTITUDES
entities.description: Unfavorable beliefs, feelings, and behaviors towards a product or brand, which may deter consumers from making a purchase

entities.name: Buying habits
entities.description: Patterns and practices of purchasing decisions made by individuals.

entities.name: Target Audience
entities.description: The target audience consists of the specific group of consumers a business aims to reach with its products or services.

entities.name: extensive information search
entities.description: Thorough examination and gathering of data before making a decision.

entities.name: behaviors
entities.description: Practical activities taken by individuals in response to their attitudes.

entities.name: MARKETING MESSAGES
entities.description: Communications from businesses designed to influence consumer perceptions and attitudes towards products or brands

entities.name: limited-time discount
entities.description: A limited-time discount is a promotional tactic used by businesses to encourage immediate purchases by offering a reduced price for a short period.

entities.name: beliefs
entities.description: Personal convictions or opinions about certain subjects.

entities.name: Collectivist cultures
entities.description: Prioritizes social relationships and group harmony.

entities.name: evaluation of alternatives
entities.description: Comprehensive assessment and comparison of different options.

entities.name: Decision-making
entities.description: A complex cognitive, emotional, and behavioral process involved in making choices.

entities.name: Culture
entities.description: Culture encompasses values, beliefs, customs, and norms that influence how individuals perceive and interact with the world around them.

entities.name: norms
entities.description: Rules of behavior considered normal or appropriate within a society.

entities.name: Marketing strategies
entities.description: Methods and plans used by businesses to promote products.

entities.name: customs
entities.description: Customs refer to the established ways of behavior and actions that are considered normal, acceptable, and appropriate within a specific culture.

entities.name: problem recognition
entities.description: The initial stage where consumers identify a need or want.

entities.name: information search
entities.description: Systematically gathering data to make informed decisions.

entities.name: product placements
entities.description: Product placements are a marketing strategy where products or brands are integrated into media content, such as movies, TV shows, and other forms of entertainment, to influence consumer attitudes.

attributes.Medium: Movies, TV shows, and other forms of entertainment

entities.name: purchase decision
entities.description: The process by which a consumer selects a product or service to purchase after evaluating alternatives.

entities.name: comparison shopping
entities.description: The process of evaluating multiple options to make an informed decision.

entities.name: premium price
entities.description: A higher cost associated with premium quality or status.

entities.name: psychology
entities.description: The systematic investigation of mental and behavioral phenomena.

entities.name: perception
entities.description: The interpretation of sensory information by an individual.

entities.name: behavioral factors
entities.description: Refers to mental processes that involve behavior and can influence decision-making.

entities.name: Consumer preferences
entities.description: Individual's likes, dislikes, and choices regarding products or services.

entities.name: consumer
entities.description: A consumer is an individual or entity that purchases goods and services for personal use or consumption.

attributes.Behavior Factors: Past Experiences, Social Influences, Cognitive Processes, Attitudes, Perception

entities.name: values
entities.description: Values represent an individual's principles and beliefs that guide their behavior and decision-making.

entities.name: Brand loyalty
entities.description: A long-term commitment to purchasing products or services from a specific brand.

entities.name: POSITIVE ATTITUDES
entities.description: Favorable beliefs, feelings, and behaviors towards a product or brand, which are more likely to result in purchase intentions

entities.name: Product or Brand
entities.description: A product or brand is a good or service that consumers can purchase and use.

entities.name: motivation
entities.description: Influences consumer decisions and actions.

entities.name: Customer Experience
entities.description: Customer experience encompasses all interactions a customer has with a business, from initial awareness through purchase and post-purchase support.

entities.name: big-ticket purchase
entities.description: A high-value product requiring significant investment.

entities.name: post-purchase evaluation
entities.description: Evaluating satisfaction and performance of the purchased product.

entities.name: quality
entities.description: Subjective assessment of product excellence

entities.name: endorsements
entities.description: Endorsements are a marketing strategy used by businesses to influence consumer attitudes and behaviors through the promotion of products or brands by celebrities, experts, or trusted individuals.

attributes.Purpose: To influence consumer attitudes and behaviors
attributes.Method: Promotion by celebrities, experts, or trusted individuals

entities.name: BRAND IMAGE
entities.description: The perception of a brand's overall quality, reputation, and value, which can influence consumer purchasing decisions

entities.name: increased sales
entities.description: Increased sales refer to a rise in the volume of products or services sold over a specific period.

entities.name: BUSINESSES
entities.description: Organizations that aim to understand consumer behavior to effectively market their products and services

entities.name: impulse purchases
entities.description: Purchases made spontaneously due to immediate emotional response.

entities.name: emotions
entities.description: Internal subjective experiences that influence behavior.

entities.name: purchase intentions
entities.description: The likelihood of purchasing a product based on positive attitudes.
